snippet: Leading oil companies in South Africa and Greece suspended imports of the country’s crude oil, further signs of emergency self-reliance emerging in Iran.
abstract: United States-led effort to impose sanctions on Iran appears to be causing new fractures in the Iranian economy; Iran has called the sanctions, aimed at stopping its uranium enrichment, a bullying tactic by the West that is doomed to fail.
lead_paragraph: Leading oil companies in South Africa and Greece suspended imports of the country’s crude oil, further signs of emergency self-reliance emerging in Iran.

headline.print_headline: Economic Distress Rises in Iran as Sanctions Tighten Knot, and Plans for Talks May Stall
